newsitem.title: USA: Rohm and Haas sees Q1 below $1.70 forecast.
newsitem.headline: Rohm and Haas sees Q1 below $1.70 forecast.

text.p: Rohm and Haas Co on Wednesday said it expected its first-quarter earnings to fall short of the current consensus forecast of $1.70 per share.

The company said in a release that exchange rates would have a negative impact on first-quarter earnings, though it said its profit should exceed the $1.46 per share reported for the same quarter of 1996.

"I remain optimistic about the full year. We expect good volume growth and ongoing, excellent progress in the areas of cost control and increased operating efficiencies," Chairman J. Lawrence Wilson said in a release.
The company, which makes plastics, chemicals and pesticides, said trading of its stock was suspended for a brief time Wednesday morning but resumed after 1000 EDT (1500GMT).
Rohm and Haas shares were trading at 76-1/2 early Wednesday afternoon, down 10-3/4.
